intro: Crassula cinerea, commonly known as the silver crassula, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features dense, compact growth with small, rounded leaves that are covered in a fine, powdery coating, giving it a silvery appearance. The leaves are typically gray-green in color and are arranged in a rosette pattern. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of white or pale pink during the summer months. This plant is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water and well-draining soil.
